doc.previous: For all reaction engines which carry their propellant onboard prior to use (such as rocket engines and electric propulsion drives) some energy must go into accelerating the reaction mass. Every engine will waste some energy, but even assuming 100% efficiency, the engine will need energy amounting to
doc.after: (where M is the mass of propellent expended and is the exhaust velocity), which is simply the energy to accelerate the exhaust.
